physical_examinations.relevant_findings: A neurologic examination exhibited symmetric and severe plastic hypertonia in the trunk and all four extremities, cogwheel rigidity at the wrists, marked bradykinesia, hypomimia, hypophonia, and upward gaze limitation. Deep tendon reflexes were normal in all four limbs.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive stiffness and slowness of movements were noted to have appeared a few months prior to the examination.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Inducible small-amplitude polyminimyoclonus was observed in the upper extremities. The patient could stand aided and walked a few steps with a slow, normal-base gait.
